t: Joel 2
The Terrible Visitation
Blow*pn a trumpet in Zion, And*ln sound an alarm on My holy mountain! Let*ln all the inhabitants of the land tremble, For*ln the day of the Lord*s is coming; Surely*ln it is near,

A*ln day of darkness and gloom, A*ln day of clouds and thick darkness. As*ln the dawn is spread over the mountains, So*iln there is a great and mighty people; There*ln has never been anything*i like it, Nor*ln will there be again after it To*ln the years of many generations.
A*ln fire consumes before them And*ln behind them a flame burns. The*ln land is like the garden of Eden before them But*ln a desolate wilderness behind them, And*ln nothing at all escapes them.
Their*ln appearance is like the appearance of horses; And*ln like war horses, so they run.
With*ln a noise as of chariots They*ln leap on the tops of the mountains, Like*ln the crackling of a flame of fire consuming the stubble, Like*ln a mighty people arranged for battle.
Before*ln them the people are in anguish; All*ln faces turn pale.
They*ln run like mighty men, They*ln climb the wall like soldiers; And*ln they each march in line, Nor*ln do they deviate from their paths.
They*ln do not crowd each other, They*ln march everyone in his path; When*ln they burst through the defenses, They*ln do not break ranks.
They*ln rush on the city, They*ln run on the wall; They*ln climb into the houses, They*ln enter through the windows like a thief.
Before*ln them the earth quakes, The*ln heavens tremble, The*ln sun and the moon grow dark And*ln the stars lose their brightness.

The*ln Lord*s utters His voice before His army; Surely*ln His camp is very great, For*ln strong is he who carries out His word. The*ln day of the Lord*s is indeed great and very awesome, And*ln who can endure it?
“Yet*ln even now,” declares the Lord,*s “Return*ln to Me with all your heart, And*ln with fasting, weeping and mourning;
And*ln rend your heart and not your garments.” Now*ln return to the Lord*s your God, For*ln He is gracious and compassionate, Slow*ln to anger, abounding in lovingkindness And*ln relenting of evil.
Who*ln knows whether He will not*i turn and relent And*ln leave a blessing behind Him, Even*iln a grain offering and a drink offering For*ln the Lord*s your God?
Blow*ln a trumpet in Zion, Consecrate*ln a fast, proclaim a solemn assembly,

Gather*ln the people, sanctify the congregation, Assemble*ln the elders, Gather*ln the children and the nursing infants. Let*ln the bridegroom come out of his room And*ln the bride out of her bridal*i chamber.

Let*ln the priests, the Lord’s*s ministers, Weep*ln between the porch and the altar, And*ln let them say, “Spare Your people, O Lord,*s And*ln do not make Your inheritance a reproach, A*ln byword among the nations. Why*ln should they among the peoples say, ‘Where*ln is their God?’ ”
Deliverance Promised
Then*pn the Lord*s will be zealous for His land And*ln will have pity on His people.

The*ln Lord*s will answer and say to His people, “Behold,*ln I am going to send you grain, new wine and oil, And*ln you will be satisfied in*i full*i with them; And*ln I will never again make you a reproach among the nations.

But*ln I will remove the northern army*i far from you, And*ln I will drive it into a parched and desolate land, And*ln its vanguard into the eastern sea, And*ln its rear guard into the western sea. And*ln its stench will arise and its foul smell will come up, For*ln it has done great things.”
Do*ln not fear, O land, rejoice and be glad, For*ln the Lord*s has done great things.
Do*ln not fear, beasts of the field, For*ln the pastures of the wilderness have turned green, For*ln the tree has borne its fruit, The*ln fig tree and the vine have yielded in full.

So*ln rejoice, O sons of Zion, And*ln be glad in the Lord*s your God; For*ln He has given you the early rain for your*i vindication. And*ln He has poured down for you the rain, The*ln early and latter rain as before.
The*ln threshing floors will be full of grain, And*ln the vats will overflow with the new wine and oil.
“Then*ln I will make up to you for the years That*ln the swarming locust has eaten, The*ln creeping locust, the stripping locust and the gnawing locust, My*ln great army which I sent among you.
You*ln will have plenty to eat and be satisfied And*ln praise the name of the Lord*s your God, Who*ln has dealt wondrously with you; Then*ln My people will never be put to shame.
Thus*ln you will know that I am in the midst of Israel, And*ln that I am the Lord*s your God, And*ln there is no other; And*ln My people will never be put to shame.
The Promise of the Spirit

“It*pn will come about after this That*ln I will pour out My Spirit on all mankind; And*ln your sons and daughters will prophesy, Your*ln old men will dream dreams, Your*ln young men will see visions.
Even*ln on the male and female servants I*ln will pour out My Spirit in those days.
The Day of the Lord
I*pn will display wonders in the sky and on the earth, Blood,*ln fire and columns of smoke.
The*ln sun will be turned into darkness And*ln the moon into blood Before*ln the great and awesome day of the Lord*s comes.

And*ln it will come about that whoever calls on the name of the Lord*s Will*ln be delivered; For*ln on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem There*ln will be those who escape, As*ln the Lord*s has said, Even*ln among the survivors whom the Lord*s calls.
